Share: Digg Facebook StumbleUpon Crop Formation Update as of May 21, 2000 - Part 2 © 2000 by Linda Moulton Howe May 1, 2000 Between Kassel and Zierenberg near little village called Burghasungen - Two circles connected by looping path way. A few days later near Kassel at Gut Rangen, a simple circle was also found in greener oilseed rape (canola). See May 21, 2000 Earthfiles.com report. May 2, 2000 Sardegna, Italy - Adriano Forgione, Director of HERA Magazine reports: "A crop formation on the Island of Sardegna, Italy appeared to be discovered May 2nd. The formation is composed of a circular shape with other three little (ones around it): three little rings, an Egyptian crux (ankh) and a little key. The length of the entire formation is 32 meters. Sardegna, like southwest England, is a land full of megalithic Neolithic structures. (No photographs yet available). May 13, 2000 Lockeridge, Wiltshire - Two triangles of different sizes touching point to point in flowering oilseed rape. Stuart Dike of www.cropcircleconnector.com took this photograph and reported, "The floor pattern on the smaller of the two triangles was not spiraled, but flattened in three directions in unison with its three sides. But the larger two triangles had a floor pattern flowing in one direction up to its apex. The smaller triangle had sides in these lengths: 5.6, 6.5 and 6.2 meters. The larger triangle had sides 8.3 meters at the base with 14.3 meters and 16.5 meters along the left and side tramline." Stuart and another photographer, Peter R. Sorensen, both commented on many broken stems snapped half way down in these triangles raising suspicions of human creation. See more details at http://www.cropcircleconnector.com. Photograph © 2000 by Stuart Dike, http://www.cropcircleconnector.com/ .

Photograph © 2000 by Peter R. Sorensen, http://cropcircleconnector.com/Sorensen /PeterSorensen99.html . May 14, 2000 Wrotham near Farningham, Kent - Second formation in spring of 2000 in Kent County between Wrotham and Farningham. Can be seen from the M20 going toward London. Graham Tucker of the Medway Crop Circle Research group reported that the young barley is already springing up and the farmer will not give permission for anyone to enter for closer examination. See more details at http://www.cropcircleconnector.com . Photograph © 2000 by Andrew King. May 18, 2000 Stantonbury Hill near Bristol, England - Julia Set of 21 circles in barley. See more details at http://www.cropcircleconnector.com . Video image © 2000 by Stuart Dike and assembled by A. J. Samuels. May 20, 2000 East Field, Alton Barnes, Wiltshire - 5- pointed star inside a circle of barley. The star appears to have been divided some how. Aerials yet to be photographed. See earthfiles.com May 22, 2000 report from Peter R. Sorensen. Photograph from Woodborough Hill overlooking East Field © 2000 by Peter R. Sorensen,
